intro: Draba ledebourii, commonly known as the Leidebour's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Draba ledebourii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
